title: Is it morally acceptable to lie according to Kant? - Quora

response.answer_text: If we watched the TV comedy, The Good Place, we might conclude that Kant was always against lying under all circumstances. Kant was firmly against lying — but even Kant made an exception — in cases of life and death. If telling the truth would result in an innocent person dying — then Kant would lie.
Let’s look at the primary two tests: Is lying universalizable?Does lying use others as a means to your ends?Lying heuristically is thus, unethical.
